title: Business Live: Dow and S&P close at new records - BBC News
summary: ryanair shares slip as pressure mounts over cancellations .

text: that 's all from the first livepage of the week .
please join us again tomorrow from 6am .

documents.title: another record for wall street
text: wall street rose to a fresh record close on monday , boosted by gains in banking and financial stocks while investors eyed this week 's meeting of the us central bank in washington .
at the closing bell , the dow jones was up 0.3 % at 22,331.3 points , while the s & p 500 rose 0.2 % to 2,503.97 , just a hair 's breadth more than friday 's prior record finish .
the tech-heavy nasdaq also eked out a positive finish , adding 0.1 % to reach 6,454.64 .

documents.title: that 's a bit rich
text: just last week jpmorgan chase boss jamie dimon called bitcoin a fraud and said he would sack anyone at the bank who trades it .
is it perhaps strange , then , that the wall street giant should be handling bitcoin-related transactions for clients ?
financial blog zerohedge thinks it is , highlighting the link in a report over the weekend .
it pointed out that , like other wall street banks , jpmorgan acts as an agent for buyers and sellers of bitcoin xbt , an exchange-traded note designed to track the value of the crypto currency .
but jpmorgan spokesman brian marchiony told reuters this evening : `` they are not jpmorgan orders .
these are clients purchasing third-party products directly . ''

documents.title: throwing money down the drain
text: swiss prosecutors are investigating why tens of thousands of euros were flushed down toilets in geneva .
the €500 ( £ 440 ; $ 600 ) notes were cut up and found in the toilets of a branch of the bank ubs and in three nearby restaurants .
thousands of francs have been spent on plumbing repairs to unclog the surrounding pipes .

`` we are not so interested in the motive but we want to be sure of the origin of the money , '' spokesman vincent derouand said , adding that neither throwing money away nor blocking a toilet was a crime .

the tribune de geneve newspaper , which first reported the unusual deposit , said the first blockage occurred in the toilet serving the vault at ubs bank in geneva 's financial district , and three nearby bistros found their facilities bunged up with 500-euro notes a few days later .

documents.title: ooops !
text: thousands of airline passengers are stranded in auckland after a burst pipeline cut fuel supplies to new zealand 's largest airport .
the pipeline is auckland airport 's only source of jet fuel .
local media said it was damaged by a digger on a rural property , causing a leak and the pipeline to be closed .
fuel supplies have been rationed and airlines are looking to refuel in australia and elsewhere to keep long-haul services running .
about 2,000 passengers were affected by cancellations on monday , according to air new zealand .
the disruption is expected to last at least a week as repair work continues , the pipeline 's operator said .

documents.title: it could be you
text: ryanair has now published a list of its flight cancellations until the end of october .
you can find it here .
good luck .

documents.title: may expects 'seamless ' canada trade deal
text: may expects 'seamless ' canada trade deal

documents.title: microsoft confirms outlook issues
text: microsoft has confirmed that some users of its email service outlook are unable to send email or access their accounts .
hundreds from around europe have commented on the website downdetectorthat they have been affected by the problem - many since monday morning .
one common issue seems to be that sent emails remain in the drafts folder and are not being delivered to recipients .
on its website , microsoft says the service dropped `` unexpectedly '' and it is working on a fix .
not all account holders are affected .
`` intermittent connectivity is affecting customers in some european countries , which we are working to resolve as soon as possible , '' said a microsoft representative .
outlook incorporates hotmail and windows live hotmail accounts .

documents.title: ge robot 'to save $ 200bn '
text: ge is developing a robot that could help save up to $ 200bn globally by improving efficiency in electricity grids .
the technology firm wants to use artificial intelligence to optimise how electricity flows in and out of batteries and points of consumption , in real time , bloomberg reports .
we 're also putting a lot into the machine learning side , a lot , '' said steven martin , chief digital officer at ge 's energy connections business .
we have a lot of people working on this . ''

documents.title: google 's counter-offer
text: google is offering to display rival comparison shopping sites , in a bid to stave off further eu antitrust fines , reuters is reporting .

in a proposal submitted to the european commission on 29 august , the company said it would allow competitors to bid for any spot in its shopping section known as product listing ads , sources familiar to the matter said .

google has already been fined a record €2.4bn by the european commission for favouring its own service , and could face millions of euros in fresh fines if it fails to treat rivals and its own service equally .

documents.title: flight check outstill waiting to see if you can fly ?
text: ryanair has said it will publish during the next few hours the full list of which flights are being cancelled .
the airline has already said which airports are in line for the cancellations .
so if you 're not going via one of the following you can relax :
barcelona , brussels , dublin , lisbon , london stansted , madrid , milan bergamo , porto and rome fiumi .

documents.title: wall street staying strong
text: all three major indices on wall street are continuing to rise , with the dow jones up 67.48 points , or 0.32 % , to 22,339.9 , while the nasdaq is up by 24.80 points , or 0.38 % , to 6,473.24 .
the s & p gained 4.77 points , or 0.19 % , to 2,505 .
the dow risers are led by machinery manufacturer caterpillar , up 1.81 % , while the biggest faller is walt disney , down 0.65 % .

documents.title: sterling extends lossescarney delivers speech to international monetary fund
text: sterling extended its losses , falling 0.8 % to $ 1.348 after bank of england governor mark carney said any future interest rate rises would be limited and gradual .
the pound jumped to a near 15-month high of $ 1.36 last week after strong hints from bank policymakers that a rate rise was likely soon .

documents.title: another hurdle cleared - one to go
text: royal bank of scotland chief ross mcewan ( above ) has welcomed the european commission 's approval of a plan for its williams & glyn division .
instead of selling the operation , rbs has promised to fund initiatives to help increase uk banking competition .
the approval of this plan leaves rbs with one major legacy issue , mcewan said - the pending huge us settlement over rbs 's role sub-prime lending .
he said : `` we are pleased that we now have final approval from the european commission for the alternative remedies package .
this allows us to resolve our final state aid divestment obligation and brings welcome clarity for our customers and staff .

`` it also builds on the progress we have made already this year in resolving our major legacy issues through reaching a settlement with the federal housing finance agency , and resolving the 2008 rights issue litigation .
`` we remain committed to resolving our last remaining major legacy issue , the investigation into our historic us rmbs activities . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 closes up
text: bae systems led the ftse 100 higher after the defence giant received an order to supply typhoon fighters to qatar .
the company 's shares jumped 4 % , helping the ftse 100 climb 0.52 % to close at 7,253 points .
troubled doorstep lender provident financial , soon to be relegated to the ftse 250 , fell 5.8 % .
the ftse 250 finished 0.31 % up at 19,437.8 .

documents.title: rbs clears hurdlebbc business editor tweets :
text: rbs non-sale of williams & glyn 's approved by eu commission .
and here 's me thinking that this duck was properly dead in 2015 smoothly efficient those ecrats .
not .

documents.title: the least worst optionmore from the ryanair press conference
text: for the airline 's boss michael o'leary the decision to cancel flights was the least worst option .
`` i 'd rather cancel 50 flights a day and have the rest run on time , '' he says , adding yet again that only 2 % of ryanair 's customers will be affected .

documents.title: rate rise gradual and limited - carneybank of england governor at the imf
text: sterling fell more than half a percent after mark carney 's speech in washington .
although the bank of england governor gave a strong signal that the time for a rise in uk interest rates was approaching , he underlined that any hikes would be limited and gradual .

he said in his speech at the international monetary fund : `` as the ( monetary policy ) committee stated last week , if the economy continues to follow a path consistent with the prospect of a continued erosion of slack and a gradual rise in underlying inflationary pressure then , with the further lessening in the trade-off that this would imply , some withdrawal of monetary stimulus is likely to be appropriate over the coming months in order to return inflation sustainably to target . ''

carney added : `` any prospective increases in bank rate would be expected to be at a gradual pace and to a limited extent , and to be consistent with monetary policy continuing to provide substantial support to the economy . ''

documents.title: o'leary wo n't resign
text: ryanair 's michael o'leary is his usual combative self , telling the press conference in dublin that those pilots who have left his airline to join long haul carriers will soon discover that the `` grass is n't necessarily greener '' .
he expects many of them to ask to return .
o'leary certainly wo n't be leaving , telling a journalist that he has no plans to resign .
also , despite being ryanai'r largest shareholder , he does n't give a `` rat 's arse '' about the damage to the share price .
the episode has done reputational damage , he accepts , but he again points out that 98 % of the airline 's passengers will not be affected .

documents.title: ryanair 's mess
text: ryanair boss michael o'leary is holding a press conference in dublin to explain the flight cancellations that have left customers in limbo .
he apologised to those affected , but pointed out that there were millions of customers whose travel plans remain as-was .
`` we want to put our hands up when we make a mess , '' he says .
`` we clearly messed up in the rostering department it 's my mess and i have to clear it up . ''
but he said some 18-20 million customers ' travel plans remain unaffected .
only 2 % of ryanair 's flights would be hit , he insisted .

documents.title: carney 's interest rate hint
text: the bank governor 's speech marks the strongest signal to date that britain 's first rate hike in a decade is approaching , despite the still big uncertainties surrounding the country 's scheduled 2019 departure from the european union .
in his speech , carney reiterated that message and said the years of rock-bottom interest rates appeared to be coming to an end as the world economy up after the global financial crisis .

he said : `` the case for a modest monetary tightening is reinforced by the possibility that global r ( equilibrium interest rates ) may be rising , meaning that monetary policy has to move in order to stand still . ''

documents.title: carney in brexit inflation warning
text: bank of england governor mark carney said brexit was likely to push up britain 's inflation rate and he reiterated the central bank 's new view that interest rates are likely to rise in the coming months .

carney , making a speech at the international monetary fund 's headquarters in washington , says the process of globalisation that has led to deeper integration in the world economy in recent decades had pushed down price growth .
but brexit represented the opposite for britain , at least in the short term , as less openness to foreign markets and workers was likely to push up inflation and reduce productivity , he says .
`` on balance , the de-integration effects of brexit can be expected to be inflationary , '' he said .
`` at present , the main question concerns the extent to which this adjustment has been brought forward . ''

documents.title: ryanair planning for up to €20m in compensation - reutersbbc personal finance correspondent tweets :
text: if ryanair is expecting to pay out £ 17.5m in compensation for all the cancelled flights , that works at £ 44 per cancelled trip .
so ryanair must think that a lot of the passengers who miss out wo n't qualify for compensation
how would that work though ?
surely everyone would be entitled ?

documents.title: ryanair 's compensation bill
text: ryanair is preparing for up to €20m in compensation claims after cancelling thousands of flights due to a shortage of staff , a spokeswoman for the irish budget airline has told reuters .
ryanair has admitted it messed up after it disrupted plans of hundreds of thousands of travellers by cancelling flights to cope with pilot shortages and improve its punctuality record .

documents.title: cisco boss stands down
text: cisco systems ' executive chairman john chambers is stepping down at the end of the year .
chambers , who led the networking gear maker for two decades as its chief executive , became the executive chairman in july 2015 .
under his leadership , cisco 's sales surged to about $ 48bn from $ 1.2bn in 1995 .
cisco 's chief executive chuck robbins will become the chairman and chambers , 68 , will be given the honorary title of chairman emeritus at the company 's annual shareholder meeting in december .

documents.title: making your mind up
text: how much do you rely on online reviews ?
after seeing amazon remove the 1 star reviews from hrc 's book , not bloody much .

documents.title: new records on wall street
text: wall street has opened on the front foot , with the dow jones and s & p 500 hitting new records .
a relatively quiet north korea and us secretary of state rex tillerson 's comments on a `` peaceful solution '' over the weekend seem to have calmed investors .
the dow rose 51.47 points , or 0.23 % , to 22,319.8 , while the s & p gained 3.3 points , or 0.13 % , to 2,503.5 .
the nasdaq added 12.60 points , or 0.2 % , to 6,461 .

documents.title: aerospace firms lead ftse 100 higher
text: aerospace firms gkn and bae systems lead the ftse 100 risers , with both up more than 3 % in mid-afternoon trading .

gkn is benefiting from a broker upgrade and positive response to a management shake-up , while bae , the uk 's biggest manufacturer , continues to rise on the back of a typhoon fighter jet order from qatar .
troubled doorstep lender provident financial lost another 4 % as it awaits demotion to the ftse 250 .
the ftse 100 was up 0.33 % at 7,239.5 points .
the mid-cap 250 was up 0.25 % at 19,427 .

documents.title: sterling dips
text: the pound is still lower against both the euro , at 1.1324 , and the dollar at $ 1.3553 .
sterling rose above $ 1.36 on friday - its highest level since the brexit vote last year - so a bit of a fall was to be expected today .
traders will also be keeping a close eye on a speech by bank of england governor mark carney at the imf in washington dc this afternoon .

however , ing currency strategist viraj patel says : `` any boe-fuelled sterling rally may be on its last legs ; what we have defined as a 'withdrawal of stimulus ' hiking cycle is now priced into the currency . ''

documents.title: ryanair chaos until christmas ?
text: a letter to ryanair pilots from the firm 's chief operating officer , michael hickey , seen by the bbc , forecasts a pilot shortage until the end of the year .
the airline has blamed a backlog of leave for cancelling 2 % of its flights .
it has only published confirmed flight cancellations until wednesday but has said the disruption will continue until the end of october .
the letter shows ryanair pilots , many of whom are on self-employed contracts , were only informed on 13 september of the staff shortage facing the company .
however , in the letter mr hickey outlined that the airline knew last year it could face a leave backlog .
pilots have been asked to work during booked holiday to cover the gaps and their rota pattern is also likely to be disrupted .

one anonymous ryanair pilot has told the bbc that the leave issue is a red herring and that the root cause of the problem is that too many pilots are leaving ryanair , which is apparently struggling to train new crew .
author: Susannah Streeter
Business presenter

documents.title: uber faces big bill
text: uber will face a big rise in the fee it pays to operate in london to almost £ 3m if the ride hailing company is granted a new licence .
transport for london said companies with more than 10,000 vehicles would pay £ 2.9m for a licence under a new multi-tiered system coming into force this week .
uber has about 40,000 drivers in london .
in 2012 , uber paid less than £ 3,000 for a five-year licence to operate in london , which was extended in may by four months partly because tfl needed to finalise its new fees system .
a decision on uber 's licence is due by the end of the month .

documents.title: google 's indian mobile payments app
text: google has launched a mobile payments app in india that will work on both android and apple smartphones .
tez allows users to make money transfers to each other and to buy goods from physical stores and mobile websites .
it is based on the country 's unified payment interface ( upi ) standard - a government-backed system launched last year to encourage digital payments .
but it will have to compete with paytm , a popular local mobile wallet system .
paytm - which is part-owned by japan 's softbank and china 's alibaba - already has more than 200 million registered users in the country .
read more here .

documents.title: would you like custard with that ?
text: business reporter elizabeth hotson has been tucking into desserts so you do n't have to
@ bbcbusiness pudding time on radio 4 's you and yours !
my report on syrup sponge , apple crumble & spotted dick :
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: cancellations may cost ryanair €34.5m
text: goodbody stockbrokers reckon that flight cancellations could cost ryanair €34.5m ( £ 30.4m ) .
the dublin-based firm says the figure would comprise €23.5m in compensation , €6.3min lost fees and €4.7m in subsistence such as meals , drinks and accommodation .
under eu rules , airlines must provide at least two weeks ' notice to avoid paying compensation of €250 per passenger for flights of 1,500 km or less or €400 for longer flights within europe .

documents.title: brexit line-up 'remains the same'bbc political editor laura kuenssberg tweets
text: negotiating line up in eu talks will stay the same , may the chief negotiator , dd the 'principal ' , robbins the most senior official
may 's previous negotiating experience ?

as far as i can see the chief has not been at the negotiations and dd spends one day a week there .

documents.title: ryanair 'must comply ' with eu rules
text: the european commission says that ryanair has to comply with eu passenger rights , including possible reimbursement and compensation .
ryanair is canceling flights after it `` messed up '' the planning of pilots holidays .
it is planning to cancel between 40 and 50 flights per day but has only published flight details up until wednesday .
a european commission spokesman tells reuters : `` airlines operating in the eu need to respect the european rules passengers whose flights are cancelled have a comprehensive set of rights . ''

documents.title: new zealand jet fuel shortage hits flights
text: it 's not just in the uk that airline passengers are facing frustration .
thousands of airline passengers are stranded in auckland after a burst pipeline cut fuel supplies to new zealand 's largest airport .
the pipeline is auckland airport 's only source of jet fuel .
local media said it was damaged by a digger on a rural property , causing a leak and the pipeline to be closed .
read the full story here .

documents.title: happy monday
text: the office of national statistics is clearly in a chipper mood today .
it has just published an interactive graphic showing the top causes of death for women and men over the last 100 years .
enjoy .
what were the top causes of death between 1915 and 2015 ?
find out with our interactive
you are right .

documents.title: typhoon sale 'worth £ 1bn '
text: more on that bae typhoon sale to qatar .
david madden , a market analyst at cmc markets uk , says the value of the sale , which has not been disclosed , is likely to be `` in excess of £ 1bn '' .
the resulting share price boost has helped bae systems recover from the knock it took in august , when the company said it would take a restructuring charge for its intelligence division .
`` that announcement sent the stock to a six-month low , '' mr madden said .

however , investor interest in the firm has continued to build : `` last month , goldman sachs added the stock to its conviction buy list , sighting saudi arabian contracts as the reason behind the move , and now they are selling to qatar too . ''

documents.title: hsbc : we were wrong
text: quite a mea culpa from hsbc , as reuters columnist jamie mcgeever points out :
`` we were wrong '' massive changes to hsbc 's sterling forecasts .
now sees cable ending this year $ 1.35 v $ 1.20 .
no longer sees eur/gbp parity .
hsbc abandons call for no uk rate hike this year or next .
now sees rate hike in november and another in may 2018 .
looks like they 're just following the market .
anyone can do that .
where 's mr bloom ? !
120 to 135 - just a 12.5 % tweak ! !
there 's still a decent chase boe have called this wrong too !
i think we will re-test 1.20
`` we were wrong '' suggests `` we could be wrong again ''
well it 's a change to their usd forecast ; they 're still bearish gbp against the eur , albeit not quite as aggressively ( 95 cents vs parity )
still too conservative vs euro for me .
especially if the rate hike goes through .

documents.title: lead brexit official moves to downing street role
text: oliver robbins , the top official at the department for exiting the european union , has quit following a year in the position according to the london evening standard .
mr robbins is moving to downing street to become theresa may 's eu adviser .

documents.title: orbital deal confirmed
text: northrop grumman has confirmed the deal to buy missile and rocket maker orbital atk for about $ 7.8bn .
the takeover , expected to close in the first half of 2018 , comes as the firing of missiles by north korea in recent months has focused attention on missile defense systems .
northrop 's offer price of $ 134.50 a share represents a premium of 22 % over the stock 's friday closing price .

documents.title: oil prices diverge
text: us and uk oil prices diverged on monday .
brent crude rose by 0.1 % to $ 55.67 a barrel .
however , west texas intermediate dipped by 0.1 % to $ 49.86 .
us oil had risen over $ 50 earlier on monday as the number of new rigs fell and refineries re-started following hurricane harvey .
anz bank said in a note : `` demand forecasts from opec and iea continued to improve sentiment in the market .
refineries are also reporting a much better recovery from the recent hurricanes . ''

documents.title: play it again
text: business presenter ben thompson tweets
if you missed us on tv , today 's # bbcbizlive is here :
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: petra falls on diamond impasse
text: shares in petra diamonds are down almost 9 % to 76.5p after the mining group said the tanzanian government continues to hold on to a package of diamonds destined for export .
petra 's williamson mine in tanzania has reopened following a four-day stoppage but says 71,654 carats in diamonds are yet to be released .
the company also reported full-year results in which revenue rose to $ 477m from $ 430.9m .
however , pre-tax profits tumbled to $ 46.5m from $ 75.4m .

documents.title: the wow factor
text: north america technology reporter dave lee has cast his mind back to tuesday 's apple shindig at the new steve jobs theater :
the more i think about it , the more the new apple watch is the story of last week .
that paddle-board demo the only `` wow '' moment all day .
the untethered apple watch is the future of mobile maybe : - )
if you have to think about it , it 's not `` wow '' moment .
story of last week was 4k movie pricing and free upgrades .

documents.title: bae jumps on qatar win
text: shares in bae systems are up 2.8 % after qatar 's defence minister signed a letter of intent to buy 24 typhoon jets .
that makes bae the second-biggest riser on the ftse 100 today and its shares have jumped about 15 % over the past 12 months .
however , qatar 's decision could anger other gulf countries that are boycotting doha .

documents.title: kpmg faces legal action
text: south africa 's revenue service ( sars ) is taking legal action against kpmg for reputational damage caused by the auditor releasing details of a confidential report it produced for the tax agency , commissioner tom moyane said on monday .
he said sars would report kpmg to finance minister malusi gigaba with a view to blacklisting the auditor for its `` unethical '' and `` unlawful '' behavior .
kpmg cleared out its south african leadership en masse on friday after damning findings from an internal investigation into work done for businessmen friends of president jacob zuma .

documents.title: defence deal ready for launch
text: us defence company northrop grumman corp is set to announce it has bought missile and rocket maker orbital atk , according to reports .
the wall street journal said the deal , expected to be worth more than $ 7.5bn ( £ 5.5bn ) , could be announced later on monday .
orbital has contracts with nasa as well as the us army .
it is based in dulles , virginia , and employs about 13,000 people .

documents.title: norwegian raids ryanair
text: more on ryanair .
a spokesperson for norwegian , the new-ish kid on the budget airline block , says it has poached 140 pilots from the irish carrier this year , which may have something to do with its problems .
`` we can confirm that 140 pilots have joined us from ryanair this year .
pilot recruitment is also underway for more pilots for our new dublin base opening later this year .

`` as an ambitious , growing airline with a huge aircraft order , norwegian looks forward to welcoming many new pilots in the future on a journey that will offer exciting , global possibilities , '' the spokesman added .

documents.title: ryanair under pressure to publish flight details
text: ryanair is under pressure to publish a full list of the flights it plans to cancel over the next six weeks , amid growing anger among customers .
the airline said on saturday it would cancel 40-50 flights every day up until 20 september , after it `` messed up '' the planning of pilot holidays .
however , it has so far only published a list of affected flights up until this wednesday .
consumer rights group which ?
said passengers needed more notice .
read the full story here .

documents.title: hsbc forecasts two rate rises
text: hsbc says that it expects the uk interest rate to rise twice by the end of 2018 .

in a note published on monday , it forecast at 25 basis points rise to 0.50 % in november - when the bank of england 's monetary policy committee ( mpc ) next meets - followed by another quarter point rise next may to 0.75 % .

hbsc economist elizabeth martins says : `` the bank of england 's mpc minutes in september were hawkish , but the subsequent comments from former doves mark carney and jan vlieghe appear to have sealed the deal . ''

documents.title: lord rose adds to chairmanships with zenith
text: lord rose , the former boss of marks & spencer , has been appointed as the chairman of car leasing company zenith .

he will continue in his roles as chairman of online grocer ocado and retailer fat face.lord rose said : `` i am impressed by zenith 's growth story : the uk fleet services market is a large , growing and resilient market so we will all have even more to go for . ''

documents.title: esure shares rise on sale speculation
text: shares in insurer esure jumped by 5.67 % to 277.50p following reports at the weekend that its founder , the multi-millionaire sir peter wood , is hoping to sell his controlling 30.7 % stake in the group .
the sunday times reported that sir peter has been in touch with insurance rivals to see if they might be interested in a deal .

documents.title: women 'more likely ' to be underpaid
text: women 'more likely ' to be underpaid
author: Brian Milligan
Personal Finance reporter

documents.title: south korea stocks rally in upbeat asian session
text: the south korea index ended at a six-week high on monday , pulled higher by surging technology stocks .
market heavyweight samsung rallied 4.1 % , while chipmaker sk hynix climbed 3.2 % .
the broader kospi index closed up 1.4 % at 2,418.21 .
elsewhere in asia , hong kong rose 1.27 % , or 352.18 points , to 28,159.77.japan 's nikkei is closed for a holiday .

documents.title: rentokil 's geoghegan steps down
text: hygiene and pest control company rentokil initial has announced that chris geoghegan has stepped down as non-executive director with `` immediate effect '' .
he was also chairman of the company 's remuneration committee and its senior independent director .
last week , the times reported that mr geoghegan received in excess of £ 100,000 for introducing the controversial gupta family to pr firm bell pottinger .
mr geoghegan previously worked at defence giant bae where he was in charge of its joint ventures .
mr geoghegan 's daughter victoria , who worked at bell pottinger was the lead pr executive for oakbay capital , an investment company owned by the guptas .
ms geoghegan was fired in july and bell pottinger has since fallen into administration after being accused of stirring up racial hatred in south africa .

documents.title: ryanair shares fall on flight cancellation debacle
text: shares in ryanair have fallen as much as 3 % after the airline announced up to 400,000 passengers could be affected by cancellations over the next six weeks .
the carrier is facing mounting pressure to publish a full list of cancelled flights after only listing affected journeys up until next wednesday .
on saturday it said it would cancel 40-50 flights every day for the next six weeks after it `` messed up '' in the planning of pilot holidays .

documents.title: gm recalls 2.5m cars over takata airbags
text: another day , another car recall linked to takata airbags .
this time general motors has announced that its joint venture partner shanghai gm will withdraw more than 2.5 million cars in china over safety fears concerning the airbags .
it follows a similar move by volkswagen which last week recalled 4.86 million vehicles in china .
japan 's takata has withdrawn about 100 million airbags globally because of the risk that they could explode with too much force and spray shrapnel .
the defective airbags have been linked to 16 deaths and scores of injuries around the world .

documents.title: uk 'must get productivity up '
text: a new report from the centre for social justice has warned uk businesses are failing to invest in their workforces and new technology , relying on cheap labour instead .
as a result , the potential of the bottom 20 % of the workforce is being `` wasted '' .

former economic adviser to boris johnson , gerard lyons , who backs the report , told today : `` in the uk we 've got a great position on employment , it 's high , unemployment is very low , but what we need to do is get the productivity side up .
`` what this report really highlights is companies do n't invest enough , we 're not innovating enough .
it also highlights a big regional divide and calls for inclusive productivity growth , so all the people even at low incomes can really benefit . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ftse opens higher
text: trading 's off and running on the london stock market and the ftse 100 has clawed back a small piece of the ground lost at the end of last week , rising 26.97 points to 7,242.44 .
the ftse 100 fell more than 2 % last week as the pound rose in response to signs that the bank of england could raise interest rates later this year .
shares in dairy crest edged up 0.4 % after the company said strong sales of cheese meant its first-half profits were expected to be higher than last year .

documents.title: statistics chief faces off against foreign secretary
text: the uk 's statistics watchdog has stood by its criticism of boris johnson in a growing row over the possible financial windfall the nhs may get from brexit .
sir david norgrove said he was `` disappointed '' the foreign secretary had , in an article , revived leave campaigners ' disputed referendum pledge of £ 350m a week extra for the nhs .
the watchdog said it was misleading and a `` clear misuse '' of figures .
read the full story here .

documents.title: have your say : will you still fly with ryanair ?
text: on # bbcbizlive : as ryanair continues to cancel 40-50 flights per day , are you put you off flying with them or is the price all that matters ?
not had a problem yet but have a flight booked next month which may get cancelled .
if it is i 'll never fly @ twitterid again
but you would if they 're only cancelling other people 's flights ?
this is like saying i should stop eating at a restaurant iv always had a good meal at .
should i stop goin if others have a bad experience ?
i think if there was a 5 % chance of my meal not arriving after too late to eat anywhere else i 'd find another restaurant , yes .
it 's not like 'bad service ' .
it 's basically a chance i do n't go on holiday .
my time off is too precious for that
understood .
my husband has booked time off & my sister has too to babysit our children .
stuff like that is n't taken into account
well - at any rate i hope you 're not one of the unlucky ones this time
thanks , i can cope with the cancellation , i 'd just want a full refund !
any compensation would go to my sister
the flight happening is all that matters .
so wo n't be booking with them again .
flight might only be £ 30 but rest of ruined trip is n't .
all the other ryanair nonsense seemed fair enough given prices - i 've never minded them - but this is unacceptable .
their one job is to get you from a to b .
that should come first .
they 've abandoned their customers with this .
should n't be forgiven .
had to rebook for nxt wk on @ twitterid could n't risk other half not arriving to deliver training in denmark .
that cost us !
never again
flew with them once , never ever again , horrible experience which started with the booking and just got worse .
he is one of the most arrogant bosses ever and does n't deserve my money .
factor in savings with possible additional costs such as additional hotel bills , lateness for work , etc
yes @ twitterid already said they may not refund my hotel .
husband & sister have booked leave & i 'm yet to order euros .
hate being in limbo
get back to uk & seek advice !
package or flight only , etc hope ryanair will meet responsibilities to you & others !
good luck stay safe !
it 's not just about the flight , what about the hotels booked , car hire , other plans you have arranged , there is a wider knock on effect !
this is true especially if you ca n't claim your hotel back

documents.title: cheese , glorious cheese
text: like wallace , dairy crest 's customers seem to love cheese .
the company says that it expects to record double-digit growth in sales volumes for cathedral city in the first half of its financial year .
dairy crest says that it expects to shift more of its four key brands - cathedral city , clover , country life and frylight - compared to the same six months of 2016 .
the cost of producing butter has increased because of the rising price of cream .
but chief executive mark allen said : `` overall , first half profits are expected to be ahead of last year . ''

documents.title: interserve names new finance chief
text: fresh from a profit warning , interserve has appointed a new finance director .

the outsourcing group , which counts docklands light railway and the uk armed forces in gibraltar and cyprus among its clients , says that mark whiteling will join the company as chief financial officer on 1 october .
he was previously the finance chief at premier farnell and is currently a non-executive director at hogg robinson group .

interserve chairman glyn barker said : `` following the appointment of debbie white as chief executive , mark 's appointment is the next step in strengthening our top team to lead the transformation of interserve . ''

documents.title: dulux dog 'alive and kicking ' despite brexit
text: dulux paint owner akzonobel has said brexit is not a big risk for its business .
the dutch firm 's new boss , thierry vanlancker , told today : `` the uk is a big market for us and the original home of the dulux dog - and the dog is alive and kicking . ''
the firm could face some supply chain issues when britain leaves the bloc , however most of its paint is made within the country it is sold .
`` for us brexit is not a big concern , and anyway for a big global company you have to adjust to any legislation or changes , and that is what we will do , '' he said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: hiscox estimates $ 150m in hurricane harvey claims
text: insurance group hiscox estimates net claims of $ 150m ( £ 110m ) in relation to hurricane harvey which devastated areas of the us .
hiscox is basing its estimates on an insured market loss of $ 25bn .
hiscox 's chief executive bronek masojada says that hurricane harvey highlighted the lack of flood cover for large parts of the us market .

`` 2017 will be an expensive year for natural catastrophes but the industry can cope , '' he says , adding that hiscox will provide an estimate for net claims from hurricane irma , once the impact of that storm has become clearer .

documents.title: pwc partners take a pay cut
text: it 's a hard life for some in the city .
partners at pwc took home £ 650,000 last financial year , down from £ 700,000 in the previous period as profits at the accountancy giant slipped .
the firm reported record uk revenues of £ 3.6bn but said a fragile business environment following the brexit vote meant profit slipped by 1 % to £ 822m .
according to the ft , that translated to an 8 % fall in profits shared out among its 953 equity partners .
this brought average profit per partner down to £ 652,000 - significantly lower than the £ 865,000 figure for partners at rival deloitte 's uk business this year .

documents.title: house price growth slows
text: uk house prices rose by 1.1 % in the year to september , according to property website rightmove , down from a 3.1 % increase in august .
london prices weighed on the figures after falling 3.2 % compared to september last year with high-end areas such as kensington and chelsea down more than 10 % .
the north east , yorkshire and the east midlands recorded house price rises .

documents.title: royal mail drops out of ftse 100
text: as previously announced , royal mail will no longer be listed in ftse 100 blue chip index from monday onwards .
chris ralph , chief investment officer at st james 's place , says the company 's share price had been performing poorly for a number of reasons .
`` it 's partly about the decline in paper mail delivery and the amount that is being sent electronically , '' he told the today programme .
and even though online shopping is booming , the recently privatised firm faces competition from newer delivery services like tmt , he said .
royal mail 's ballooning pension scheme is n't helping much either .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: codependent fashion
text: maria malone , principle lecturer for fashion business at manchester met 's fashion institute , reckons that jimmy choo and michael kors need each other .
ahead of an investor vote of the deal on monday , she tells wake up to money that jimmy choo has gone through `` turbulent times '' because it has been bought and sold so many times .
while michael kors has expanded very rapidly which `` may have diluted the brand . ''
it may also mean that jimmy choo may produce a diffusion line for those shoe-lovers who ca n't afford a hefty price tag .
ms malone says that although jimmy choo and michael kors are considered luxury brands `` both have very different price points '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: uk growth figures revised upwards
text: influential economics consultancy the centre for economics and business research says that the uk economy will grow 1.6 % in 2017 - up from from a previous estimate of 1.3 % .
senior economist oliver kolodseike told today that a couple of factors led to its revision .

`` one manufacturing has been performing a lot more strongly than it has in the first half of the year another is that the squeeze on consumer spending will come to an end towards the end of the year so inflation has more or less plateaued .
and we believe wages will up too . ''
he expects the bank of england to raise interest rates this year , but does n't think it will dampen growth .
however a 1.6 % growth rate is still only about half as fast as the eurozone is expected to grow in 2017 , he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: rolling stone searches for new home
text: rolling stone has been put up for sale by the man who started the influential music magazine 50 years ago .
jann wenner founded rolling stone in 1967 and continues to run it with his son gus .
gus wenner told the new york times that the future looks challenging for a family-run business .
`` there 's a level of ambition that we ca n't achieve alone , '' he says .
`` so we are being proactive and want to get ahead of the curve . ''
in 2016 , it sold a 49 % stake to singapore company bandlab technologies , which is headed by kuok meng ru , the head of one of asia 's richest families .

documents.title: ryanair flight cuts are an 'operational disaster '
text: ryanair is being forced to cancel hundreds of flights because it has `` messed up '' the planning of pilots ' holidays .
aviation expert julian bray says this is not a pr disaster but an operational and marketing disaster and could seriously impact ryanair 's profits .
he tells wake up to money : `` someone needs to get a grip of this and release details of what will happen in the coming months . ''
he adds that the compensation bill `` will be very interesting '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: may to discuss bombardier row with trudeau
text: prime minister theresa may is in ottawa on monday when she will meet her canadian counterpart justin trudeau .
she is expected to discuss a growing row involving the canadian aircraft company bombardier .
the us is threatening to hit bombardier with tariffs , claiming it 's unfairly supported by uk and canadian subsidies .
pm to discuss bombardier trade dispute with justin trudeau

documents.title: investors to vote on jimmy choo deal
text: on monday , luxury shoe-maker jimmy choo will hold an annual general meeting to allow shareholders to vote on its $ 1.2bn takeover by michael kors .
the deal marks the fifth time the brand has been sold since it was founded in 1996 , proving that beautiful footwear never goes out of style .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live on what promises to be a lively start to the week .
bank of england governor mark carney is in washington to give a speech at the international monetary fund .
following rising speculation last week that the uk interest rate may rise in the coming months - which put a rocket under sterling - mr carney 's comments will be closely scrutinised .
though given his past record on forward guidance , `` unreliable boyfriend '' mr carney may decide to steer clear of commenting on interest rates at all .
